instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID_RIGHT: What is SMC_LID_RIGHT? SMC_LID_RIGHT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the right LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_RIGHT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.BKLT_EN_R: What is BKLT_EN_R? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. The “_R” suffix means that the signal is asserted when it is high, as in 3.3v, which is the opposite of the “_L”  suffix.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A WORKS ON EXTERNAL DISPLAY ONLY
threads.message:
Good day guys, have got this board that displays fine on an external display but a black screen on its the internal screen. unit is not liquid damaged, below are some of the screen connector measurements 


<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_BUF_EN</SIGNAL> =3.2V

<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>= 3.2V

<SIGNAL>I2C_TCON_SDA_CONN</SIGNAL>=3.2V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>= 3V

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> =5V

[B]<SIGNAL>LID_CTRL_DMIC</SIGNAL>=1.8V[/B]

<SIGNAL>IPD_LID_OPEN</SIGNAL>= 1.8V

<SIGNAL>LID_OPEN_LEFT</SIGNAL>= 1.5V

<SIGNAL>LID_OPEN_RIGHT</SIGNAL>=1.5V

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL>=1.5V

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL>=1.5V

Please where else do i need to look at

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A WORKS ON EXTERNAL DISPLAY ONLY
threads.message:
Don't bother with lid signals, once you get LCD power rails.
This is not possible if lid signals are bad.

Any history available?
Isn't covered by Apple flexgate issue program?

Check voltage and diode mode at L8420; w/ and w/o screen connected.
<SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_R</SIGNAL> stays high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A WORKS ON EXTERNAL DISPLAY ONLY
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A WORKS ON EXTERNAL DISPLAY ONLY
threads.message:
Also forgot to mention that am using a fully functional screen, works on a different board.

L8420 stays at 0.032V 
DIODE MODE WITHOUT SCREEN 1.272
DIODE MODE WITH SCREEN 1.270

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A WORKS ON EXTERNAL DISPLAY ONLY
threads.message:
Do you get image on internal LCD?
Could be dificil to confirm it w/o backlight, but try.

PP3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> present?
Post <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> level.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A WORKS ON EXTERNAL DISPLAY ONLY
threads.message:
PP3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> voltages are present 
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> =3.3V

And I am unable to spot any presence of  image

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A WORKS ON EXTERNAL DISPLAY ONLY
threads.message:
At least LCD is detected, but image should appear before backlight.

Try changing the small LCD flex cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A WORKS ON EXTERNAL DISPLAY ONLY
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A WORKS ON EXTERNAL DISPLAY ONLY
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> comes out from PCH.
Not a good sign.

Try PRAM reset, just in case.
